string-array.name: breeds
string-array.item: Bengal
Persian
Siamese
Maine Coon
Sphynx
Ragdoll
British Shorthair
Russian Blue
Scottish Fold
Abyssinian

string-array.name: description
string-array.item: The Bengal cat is a striking breed known for its wild appearance, featuring leopard-like spots or marbled coats. Highly active, intelligent, and playful, Bengals love climbing and need lots of stimulation and interaction.

Persian cats are calm, affectionate companions with long, luxurious coats and distinctive flat faces. They enjoy a quiet environment and gentle attention, making them ideal lap cats for relaxed homes.

Siamese cats are elegant, social, and famously vocal. They form strong bonds with their owners and thrive on interaction. Their sleek bodies, almond-shaped blue eyes, and pointed color pattern make them visually stunning.

Known as the “gentle giant” of the cat world, the Maine Coon is one of the largest domestic cat breeds. Friendly, affectionate, and intelligent, they have a shaggy coat and bushy tail and adapt well to families.

The Sphynx is a hairless cat breed that’s known for its warmth and extroverted personality. Despite their lack of fur, Sphynx cats are affectionate, playful, and love attention, often acting like little clowns.

Ragdolls are known for their docile temperament and tendency to go limp when picked up. They are large, affectionate, and enjoy cuddling, making them perfect indoor companions who follow their humans around.
This breed is dignified and easygoing, with a thick, plush coat and a teddy bear-like appearance. British Shorthairs are independent but affectionate, and they adapt well to indoor living.

Russian Blues are elegant and shy cats with short, dense, silver-blue coats and vivid green eyes. They are loyal to their family, intelligent, and reserved around strangers, making them perfect quiet companions
Known for their unique folded ears and round face, Scottish Folds are sweet-natured, quiet, and loving. They are adaptable to most households and enjoy calm environments and soft interactions.

Abyssinians are among the most active and intelligent breeds. With their slender build and ticked coat, they resemble ancient Egyptian cats. They love exploring, climbing, and being involved in household activities.
